{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3331756,"name":"richtop","username":"richtop","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T01:50:37.005Z","cooked":"

In our first year implementing a swerve drive, we’ve encountered a significant learning curve but successfully implemented field-oriented swerve drive, which is quite exciting.

However, during a recent tournament, our drive team observed abnormal robot behavior, leading us to suspect gyro failure, particularly after impacts. To address this, we introduced a gyro reset button, but this workaround didn’t resolve the issue. Further debugging and monitoring the gyro angle on Shuffleboard revealed that while the robot is stationary on the cart, the gyro angle adjusts as expected when the cart rotates. However, pressing the reset button resets the angle to zero and subsequently fails to update the gyro angle in response to directional changes. Oddly, the issue seems to correlate with the speed of rotation after initiating the reset.

We have attempted several troubleshooting steps, including:

  • Testing different gyros (connected via SPI port),
  • Swapping RoboRIOs,
  • Switching to an IMU (also via SPI port).

Our drive train code is available here for reference: DriveSubsystem.java on GitHub

Moving forward, our plan includes:

  • compiling and deploying the code from a different computer and
  • using a NAVX2 plugged into the expansion port, once it arrives.

I am at a loss to explain this peculiar behavior and am open to any suggestions or insights that could help resolve this issue or shed light on the cause.

Which models of gyro have you tried? I would expect some models of gyro to perform worse under impact than others.

Separately, you have a bug in your reset code. A RunCommand will run it’s lambda once every loop iteration until you cancel it. You want an InstantCommand or Commands.runOnce like:

    new JoystickButton(leftJoystick, PS4Controller.Button.kTriangle.value) 
    .onTrue(Commands.runOnce(()-> m_robotDriveREV.zeroHeading()));

Good point hammering the reset() command probably not doing any good.
Gyro tried are several: ADXRS450_Gyro
And just tried the: ADIS16470_IMU

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T01:59:18.737Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458483,"topic_slug":"why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change","display_username":"richtop","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23611,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change/458483/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331776,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T02:22:54.705Z","cooked":"

Before you implemented the reset button, how much error were you noticing in the output after a collision? Did you continue to notice the error with the ADIS16470?

I would stick with the ADIS16470 over the ADXRS450 at least until you get the NavX; looking at the datasheet it should have significantly better performance. The sensor is better, and it provides “delta angles” to the RIO, rather the RIO integrating the angular rate from the gyro itself.

I think you have thrown yourself threw a loop by changing RIOs/etc., when the initial issues you were having were likely because the 300 degrees/sec maximum range of the ADXRS450 was exceeded during a collision, and your debugging was confounded by a completely broken reset button.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T02:31:48.157Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":9.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458483,"topic_slug":"why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":23611,"username":"richtop","name":"richtop","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/74df32/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change/458483/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331810,"name":"richtop","username":"richtop","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T02:51:22.386Z","cooked":"

In response to your questions, the erratic behavior noted wasn’t necessarily about a change in downfield direction but a general driving issue, which was hard to diagnose due to the myriad pressures of competition and the swerve being new to our team and the driver. This problem wasn’t present during pre-tournament practices but seemed to occur more frequently as the tournament went on. (we actually started with the reset button but removed it to simply the system and remove that as a potential source of the problem) only adding it back in later since the problem was persisting.

I appreciate your suggestion on sticking with the ADIS16470 for its superior performance and provision of delta angles. It’s clear now that the reset button issue was causing a red herring, possibly diverting attention from the real problem.

Reflecting on the situation, and potentially pushing the ADXRS450 beyond its 300 degrees/sec limit, I wonder if the issue may be caused by the way the roboRIO is mount though I think it is pretty solid so should not be jerked around. Our successful reliance on the ADRS450 in autonomous mode perhaps gave me misplaced confidence in the ADXRS450’s capabilities to work reliably in teleop.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T02:51:22.386Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":27.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458483,"topic_slug":"why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change","display_username":"richtop","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23611,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change/458483/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332083,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T15:43:18.583Z","cooked":"
richtop:

issue may be caused by the way the roboRIO is mount though I think it is

I would think you could rotate fast enough to throw the gyro off even if the gyro is mounted perfectly. 300 degrees/sec seems like a lot, but 30 degrees in a tenth of second during a collision seems in the realm of possibility.

richtop:

which was hard to diagnose due to the myriad pressures of competition and the swerve being new to our team and the driver.

Yep, I know how that can be. Maybe a way you can test at home is run into a (sufficiently sturdy) wall, and see if the driving issues reappear. Good luck at your next competition!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T15:46:33.249Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":14.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458483,"topic_slug":"why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/why-would-resetting-the-gyro-cause-getangle-to-apparent-start-report-rate-of-change/458483/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335155,"name":"richtop","username":"richtop","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T15:30:18.842Z","cooked":"

@Max_Morehead thanks for the help, the NavX is installed, and we fixed the reset button code, now the driver can reorientate to field at any time (though hopefully, we don’t need it). We ran it into a previous year’s robot 5 or 6 times before we ran out of time but the driving remained consistent. We were able to get radio fault (that happened in our last match) to reoccur so we we will be working on tracing that down and fixing it.
Thanks for your help and insights.

Rich
